solution_line_template: So, {math_students} + {english_students} = <<{math_students}+{english_students}={math_english_students}>>{math_english_students} students like either Math or English.

Thus, {total_students} - {math_english_students} = <<{total_students}-{math_english_students}={remaining_students_after_math_english}>>{remaining_students_after_math_english} students neither like Math nor English.

Since {science_fraction} of the remaining like Science, therefore {remaining_students_after_math_english} x {science_fraction} = <<{remaining_students_after_math_english}*{science_fraction}={science_students}>>{science_students} students like Science.

Hence, {remaining_students_after_math_english} - {science_students} = <<{remaining_students_after_math_english}-{science_students}={no_favorite_subject_students}>>{no_favorite_subject_students} students neither likes the 3 subjects.
